From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Bikol Central

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • demonstrar

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Spanish demostrar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Hyphenation: de‧mos‧trar
  • IPA(key): /demosˈtɾaɾ/ [d̪e.mosˈtɾaɾ]

Verb

[edit]

demostrar

  1. to demonstrate

Derived terms

[edit]
  • demostraron
  • idemostrar
  • magdemostrar

Related terms

[edit]
  • demostrasiyon

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin dēmōnstrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [də.musˈtɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [də.mosˈtɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [de.mosˈtɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

demostrar (first-person singular present demostro, first-person singular preterite demostrí, past participle demostrat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /ɔ/(transitive)

  1. to show; to demonstrate
    Synonyms: mostrar, palesar
  2. to prove
    Synonym: provar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of demostrar (first conjugation)

gerund demostrant

plural demostrats demostrades

negative (no) — no demostris no demostri no demostrem no demostreu no demostrin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • demostrança

Related terms

[edit]
  • demostrable
  • demostració
  • demostrador
  • demostratiu
  • mostrar

References

[edit]
  • “demostrar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Galician-Portuguese, from Latin dēmonstrāre.

Verb

[edit]

demostrar (first-person singular present demostro, first-person singular preterite demostrei, past participle demostrado)

  1. to demonstrate
  2. to prove

Conjugation

Related terms

[edit]
  • amosar, mostrar

Old Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin dēmonstrāre.

Verb

[edit]

demostrar

  1. to demonstrate; to show

Related terms

[edit]
  • mostrar

Descendants

[edit]
  • Occitan: demostrar

References

[edit]
  • Walther von Wartburg (1928–2002), “dēmonstrāre”, in Französisches Etymologisches Wörterbuch, volume 3: D–F, page 3

Spanish

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • demonstrar (disused)

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin dēmōnstrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /demosˈtɾaɾ/ [d̪e.mosˈt̪ɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: de‧mos‧trar

Verb

[edit]

demostrar (first-person singular present demuestro, first-person singular preterite demostré, past participle demostrado)

  1. to show, to demonstrate
  2. to prove

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of demostrar (o-ue alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive demostrar
gerund demostrando
past participle masculine feminine
singular demostrado demostrada
plural demostrados demostradas

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • demostrable
  • demostración
  • demostrador
  • demostradora
  • demostradriz
  • demostrativo
  • servir para demostrar (“to be useful to show”)
  • venir a demostrar (“to go to show”)

Related terms

[edit]
  • feria de muestras
  • mostrador
  • mostrar
  • mostrario, muestrario
  • mostrear, muestrear
  • mostreo, muestreo
  • muestra
  • premostrar

See also

[edit]
  • evidenciar
  • mostrar

Further reading
